definition: to compute on the abacus/(fig.) to calculate/to plan/to scheme
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: I could write on paper and use abacus for statistic.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用纸笔写作，要算统计时就打算盘。

sentences.english: But I am interested in using an abacus.
sentences.chinese: 可我对打算盘还是很感兴趣。

sentences.english: So am I. Using an abacus is still a basic accounting.
sentences.chinese: 我也一样，打算盘仍然是会计的基本技能。

definition: to do a sum in writing/written calculation
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]
needlework/working for a living as a needleworker
to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
